kcores_algorithm

Class KCoreDecomposition

  • java.lang.Object
    • kcores_algorithm.KCoreDecomposition

  • public class KCoreDecomposition
extends java.lang.Object
    K-core node partitioning of a graph.
    Author:
    Andreou Dimitris, email: jim.andreou (at) gmail.com
    See Also:
    K-Core article on Wikipedia, "S. B. Seidman, 1983, Network structure and minimum degree, Social Networks 5:269-287"

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static KCoreDecomposition execute(gr.forth.ics.graph.InspectableGraph g)
      The execute() method creates a K-core decomposition for the specified graph.
      java.util.Set<gr.forth.ics.graph.Node> getCore(int kcore)
      The method getCore() returns the set of nodes of the specified k-core, or an empty set (but not null) if there is no such core.
      java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<gr.forth.ics.graph.Node>> getCores()
      The method getCores() returns all non-empty cores indexed by their "k" index.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getCores

        public java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<gr.forth.ics.graph.Node>> getCores()
        The method getCores() returns all non-empty cores indexed by their "k" index.
        Returns:
        all non-empty cores indexed by their "k" index

      • getCore

        public java.util.Set<gr.forth.ics.graph.Node> getCore(int kcore)
        The method getCore() returns the set of nodes of the specified k-core, or an empty set (but not null) if there is no such core.
        Parameters:
        kcore - the core to return
        Returns:
        the nodes of core specified, or an empty set if there is no such core
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kcore < 1

      • execute

        public static KCoreDecomposition execute(gr.forth.ics.graph.InspectableGraph g)
        The execute() method creates a K-core decomposition for the specified graph. The graph remains unmodified.
        Parameters:
        g - the graph for which to create the K-core decomposition
        Returns:
        the K-core decomposition
